body.name: SANSUI Computer Monitor 24 inch IPS Eye Care 1080P Display HDMI,VGA Ports with 178° Viewing Angle/Frame-Less/Tilt/VESA Compatible for Office and Home(ES-24X5AL)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 3 hrs 16 mins
features: 🌈24” IPS Eye Care VESA Monitor for Home, Game and Office
⚡Refresh Rate: 60Hz/75Hz(up to 75Hz); Resolution: 1920*1080(FHD); Brightness: 250Nits; FreeSync Technology
🔌Interface: HDMI 1.4 & VGA Ports (HDMI Cable include); No speakers and headphone jack.
🖥️Ergonomic Design: Easy Mount Stable Stand, -5°~22°Tilt , 178°V/H Viewing Angle, 75×75mm VESA Compatible
🧰Warranty: SANSUI 24 inch monitor offer a 30-day money-back and free replacement warranty from order date and lifetime technical support.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely a great monitor for the price
reviews.reviewText: This monitor is not only aesthetically pleasing, it’s very sleek and has minimal bezels. I feel this is the perfect size for a monitor, and for the price point you could connect another one or two of these, and make a very professional set up. The picture quality actually also amazed me for the price point. If you were looking for a decently, cheap monitor, that is great for gaming, schoolwork, productivity, media, etc. this is definitely the moderator for you. and keep in mind, I don’t usually write reviews unless I am very impressed with the product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars very good price for a fine monitor
reviews.reviewText: plugged it in and turned it on, had to adjust the fonts again, but it is bright and clear.Win10 updated to WIN11, works perfectly with generic drivers. stand is sturdy for a monitor, onboard speakers are good for monitor speakers, but better speakers are needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was an easy monitor to mount, connect and setup. The picture quality is very good through the HDMI port. The sound quality isn't the best but, you buy monitors for visuals not audio.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars cheap no frills USB-C 1080p monitor. better as a TV screen attached to a streamer.
reviews.reviewText: we really really wanted to love this monitor and if all you did was connect a streamer to it and turn it into a smart TV (HD version of Chromecast w Google TV is nice as it "upgrades" your monitor w a remote for power & volume!) - you're likely to do just fine!The first quality issue was just attaching the stand to the panel. it's metal (which is good) but it nearly sliced my thumb open trying to push it in (thankfully my thumb only got an internal blood clot & the doctor said it is fine). Even though it didn't go all the way in, it was snug enough that we decided to use it anyways.The next annoyance are the controls - I can't blame Sansui but after spending 20 more bucks on an LG, OMG - a joystick control is infinitely more intuitive (even better than a Samsung rubber crosspad one) - this was worth the price of admission by itself. Now to be fair, because this unit was intended to set it once and leave it - we didn't think it mattered and at the end of the day, it's nice to know you can adjust the color without this internal resistance to battling the menus.The unit does have speakers. We learned the hard way that manufacturers (even good ones like Dell) cut corners & don't include any decent speakers of value (they figure you're likely to connect external speakers so it's a probability game) - so why include them at all? why not put the money towards a better screen (or better menu UI!) so that's exactly what we did with the LG I mentioned above - no speakers - all the quality goes into the screen & menu interface & overall polish of the exterior. A $10 BT speaker w AUX in sounds better (I'm not exaggerating - this is what we got though I'd recommend budgeting $20-30 if you want more fullness in sound)I was impressed it came with *both* a USB-C and HDMI cables - while we didn't need them, we knew they were worth 15 bucks or so (so factor this in)They use a power brick on this monitor - which is easy to just leave on the floor (contrast this to a HUGE LG 3-prong adapter that is expected to plug into the wall!) - so this was a plus for the Sansui.The VA panel is bright. the contrast & brightness were only at 50% & it looked just as bright as the LG we got at 80%. SANSUI claims it has a 3000:1 ratio. I dunno if it's really this high but it's high (and VA panels are known for this over IPS)This is basically the cheapest USB-C monitor you can get - I'd say good bang for the buck. you'll get power delivery (PD) to a device like an iPadPro w USB-C.Unfortunately, we've been spoiled by Apple Retina displays so 4k monitors are the only way to go for us & we need to spend the extra money - it's impossible to go back. We would only use this screen as a TV viewed from at least 10 feet away - it is personal preference as to whether 1080p is good enough for you as a desktop monitor!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gaming monitor for a deal!
reviews.reviewText: What a steal! This thing is amazing compared to others we have tried for my son's gaming set up! He absolutely loves it and the picture is crystal clear!

reviews.reviewText: The shelf my desk mount was on fell and my monitors both survived. One had a scratch, but was otherwise okay. Definitely can’t complain for the price

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Looks and works GREAT! Easy set up.GREAT price !

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job, but picture quality and controls could have been better
reviews.reviewText: Pros:1. Cheap price2. Perfect size3. LightweightCons:1. Screen quality could have been better2. It takes a while to get used to the controls at the back. I can't see the buttons and need to memorize them. If they had so many buttons, I would recommend putting them on the front3. Bezels are so thin that the webcam covers the top of the screen.4. The stand is not sturdy. Easy to topple monitor.

This monitor looks good. It has speakers. The speaker wattage is clearly mentioned in the ad and as you can imagine, the loudness and fidelity isn't amazing. I am happy with this monitor however, my main complaint isn't with this brand or model, but more holistic. When running a large 27" monitor that is only 1080p, the text will suffer when sitting close to it as a computer monitor. I'd assume if using as a TV and sitting farther away, it wouldn't be as noticeable. For the price, it is great but my next monitor at this size will be 4k. I give full stars because monitor is exactly as described, and it is my fault for not buying a 4k monitor at twice the price.
There was no problem to connect this monitor to the computer after disconnecting the decades-old defective monitor. This new one is working perfectly.

I was hesitant to purchase a low priced/unknown brand, but this unit is absolutely beautiful. The Bezel is quite thinner than my hi-priced Ac&R unit it sits beside. The stand seems to be a bit Flimsy, but no more than my VERY expensive name brand unit that it sits beside. It has a USB Power out which is quite handy, and came with a USB Cable, and HDMI cable as well.
